section.text: *NOTE: This section was created by temporary legislation that will expire on March 29, 2024.*
section.heading: Restaurant disclosure requirement.

para.text: A third-party meal delivery service shall:
Disclose to a covered restaurant, in plain language, the fees, commissions, and charges associated with the contracted services in the agreement; and
Maintain all contracts with covered restaurants in its records for 3 years after the date the agreement is executed.

annotations.annotation: For temporary (90 days) creation of this section, see § 2(e) of Food Delivery Fees Transparency Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2023 (D.C. Act 25-199, July 26, 2023, 70 DCR 10748).
For temporary (225 days) creation of this section, see § 2(e) of Food Delivery Fees Transparency Temporary Amendment Act of 2023 (D.C. Law 25-38, Aug. 17, 2023, 70 DCR 9412).
